doc.repnme: Electricity reforms : what some countries did right and others can do better
doc.abstracts: Since 1982 more than half the world's countries have reformed their electricity sectors. Implemented correctly, the standard reform model, with competition, unbundling, and effective regulation, can lead to big gains in performance. But most developing countries lack institutional preconditions for fully adopting the model, and hybrid electricity markets are emerging. Developing pricing schemes that strike a better balance between economic efficiency and social equity remains a big challenge. An even greater challenge is to meet global energy needs while reducing the threat of climate change disruption.
